com.bandyer.core_av.audiosession

Class AudioSession

  • com.bandyer.core_av.audiosession.AudioSession

  • public class AudioSession

    AudioSession class is used to represent and audio session that uses output hardware devices to route audio during audio/video calls. This class performs automatic best hardware selection upgrading audio session from earpiece/speaker to wired headset and, if present, bluetooth devices. This class must be binded to the activity lifecycle calling initialize(context), resume(context), pause(context) and dispose(context) methods Following permission must be added in order to let audio session scan bluetooth devices and modify audio settings:

      • startWithOptions

        public void startWithOptions(android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity context,
                             AudioSessionOptions options,
                             AudioSessionListener listener,
                             ProximitySensorListener proximityListener)

        Request audio session to initialize with audio session options. Context is requested and never stored. Be sure to follow activity lifecycle and always call dispose on audio session module to prevent activities leaks.

        Parameters:
        context - context used to initialize wired headset and bluetooth broadcast receiver.
        options - options to be used in audio session initialization
        listener - audio session listener to be notified for hardware output changes.
        proximityListener - listener to be notified when the proximity sensor has been triggered

        Dispose must be called when starting activity is finished to let audio session unregister receivers and remove observers.

      • changeAudioOutputDevice

        public void changeAudioOutputDevice(AudioOutputDeviceType audioDeviceType)

        Request audio session to select a new hardware output device.

        Parameters:
